alert.note: Alert for Laramie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 31 at 5:28PM MDT until May 31 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 615 PM MDT. * At 528 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Buford to near Hereford, moving northwest at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, Burns, South Greeley, Hillsdale, Federal, Crystal Lake Reservoir, Crystal Lake Campground, Granite Springs Reservoir, Ranchettes, Granite Springs Campground, Warren AFB, Frontier Park, Whitaker, North Cheyenne, Horse Creek, Warren Af Base, Carpenter, Fox Farm-College and South Greeley High. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 32. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 339 and 398. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
